07:30:00.name: Registration and Breakfast
07:30:00.description: Pick up your badge, goodies, and enjoy breakfast. You must have a government-issued photo ID to receive a badge and check in to the event.

10:00:00.name: Keynote
10:00:00.speaker: Darin Fisher
10:00:00.description: The state of Chrome and the Web Platform today, from the leader of the Chrome team.

10:30:00.name: Building Progressive Web Apps Today
10:30:00.speaker: Thao Tran
10:30:00.description: Progressive Web Apps are all about improving your user experience. Thao shares some success stories and gives some guidance.

11:30:00.name: Web Payments
11:30:00.speaker: Zach Koch
11:30:00.description: One of the hardest web user experience challenges is enabling users to make payments. Zach shows us how with the new Web Payment API.

12:00:00.name: Sign-in on the Web - Credential Management and Best Practices
12:00:00.speaker: Sabine Borsay
12:00:00.description: Sabine shares best practices for sign-in, and explains how the Credential Management API makes frictionless sign-in possible.

13:30:00.name: Debugging The Web
13:30:00.speaker: Paul Irish
13:30:00.description: Learn the state of the art in debugging using Chrome DevTools - all you need to know to expand your toolbox.

14:00:00.name: Web Components and Polymer
14:00:00.speaker: TBD
14:00:00.description: Come learn the current state of Polymer, and how you can use Web Components to improve your development.

14:30:00.name: Progressive Performance
14:30:00.speaker: Alex Russell
14:30:00.description: Alex shows us the important things to focus on in performance, and how to run great experiences on slow, inconsistent networks and low-power devices.

15:00:00.name: Planning for Performance: PRPL
15:00:00.speaker: Sam Saccone
15:00:00.description: Sam explains how to get the browser to do things under budget - script and resource loading and more.

16:00:00.name: Security (HTTP/2 leading to HTTPS)
16:00:00.speaker: Adrienne Porter Felt & Emily Stark
16:00:00.description: Adrienne and Emily show why the default for the web should be secure, and explain to developers the complexities and opportunities of HTTPS and HTTP/2.

16:30:00.name: Predictability for the Web
16:30:00.speaker: Rick Byers & Robert Nyman
16:30:00.description: Rick and Robert explain how Chrome is improving predictability for developers, how we responsibly move the web platform forward, and how web developers can help improve the platform.

17:00:00.name: Chrome Leadership Panel
17:00:00.speaker: TBD
17:00:00.description: The leaders of the Chrome project answer your questions.

07:30:00.name: Registration and Breakfast
07:30:00.description: If you missed registration on Day 1, you can still get your badge and goodies. You must have a government-issued photo ID to receive a badge and check in to the event. Breakfast will also be served.

10:00:00.name: How Web Built It
10:00:00.speaker: TBD
10:00:00.description: A Progressive Web App vendor shows you their journey to a great user experience.

10:30:00.name: From AMP to PWA - the best of both worlds
10:30:00.speaker: Paul Bakaus
10:30:00.description: Paul explains the opportunity in AMP, and how to build great Progressive Web Apps with AMP.

11:30:00.name: Production PWAs with frameworks
11:30:00.speaker: Addy Osmani
11:30:00.description: Addy works through building Progressive Web Apps with different common development frameworks.

12:00:00.name: May We Help You? Tools and Libraries for Progressive Web Apps
12:00:00.speaker: Jeff Posnick
12:00:00.description: Jeff walks through Lighthouse and all the tools and libraries we produce to help web developers easily build great Progressive Web Apps.

13:30:00.name: The State of Storage
13:30:00.speaker: Dru Knox
13:30:00.description: Dru explores the landscape of storage APIs: past, present and future, provides best practices and explains the finer details.

14:00:00.name: Future App Model: Advanced Service Worker
14:00:00.speaker: Jake Archibald
14:00:00.description: Jake (one of the originators of Service Workers) shares the future of the web app model, with Foreign Fetch, Streams and more.

14:30:00.name: Advanced JS performance with V8 and Web Assembly
14:30:00.speaker: Seth Thompson
14:30:00.description: Seth shares the current state of JavaScript and script tooling in V8, and discusses the future with WebAssembly.

15:00:00.name: What Comes Next for the Web?
15:00:00.speaker: Paul Kinlan
15:00:00.description: Paul shares the next visionary steps for the web, with WebVR, Houdini, Performance and more.

list.title: Firebase
list.description: It's hard to know exactly how to get started building a world-class Progressive Web App. Firebase can help kickstart your PWA and scales with you no matter how big your app grows. Learn how to leverage Firebase to implement an instant-loading, offline-ready, push re-engaging web app in record time.

list.title: AMP as starting point
list.description: We see AMP as one of the best starting points into your user journey. That means the first link people click onto is always a super fast loading AMP page. Do you agree? And if not, why not? What stops you from embracing AMP for your strategy, and what would AMP need to change or provide to get there? Discuss!

list.title: From zero to service worker.
list.description:
A hands-on walkthrough of using service worker libraries to add in offline and instant-loading support to a few classes of web apps:

  • Static-only web apps, using just sw-precache.
  • Web apps that make API calls, using sw-precache + sw-toolbox.
  • Tips for adding in the libraries to different types of build processes (gulp, WebPack, npm scripts).

list.title: Media techniques & approaches
list.description:
It's simple to add video to your website, but how can you deliver great performance even when connectivity is poor and bandwidth is limited?

In this session, you’ll learn how to use adaptive streaming to deliver a great video experience across devices and platforms, even on flaky networks or offline:

  • Techniques to make the most of the video element.
  • Responsive design for media elements.
  • Building a plugin-free video player that adapts to bandwidth and device capabilities.
  • How to add captions, subtitles and synchronised metadata.
  • Recording and streaming from canvas and media elements.
  • WebRTC integration.
  • Encoding and packaging basics.
  • Media delivery testing across devices and different bandwidths.

list.title: Web Assembly
list.description: Web Assembly will give you the flexibility to use whatever language you choose to create small, fast web content. We'll be dispelling some myths and answering questions, with plenty of opportunity to discuss the kinds of tools

list.title: Push Notifications and Background
list.description: Push Notifications have grown to be an important part of the Progressive Web App experience. We'll discuss the most recent learnings, new features and will take a look at new APIs such as the Budget API, Background Sync and Background Fetch.

list.title: WebVR
list.description: With the WebVR API you will be able to present your web content onto any VR device, from fancy commercial head-mounted-displays to pieces of cardboard. We'll have a brief introduction to the API followed by a group discussion about what you, as developers, want to get out of it.

list.title: Scalable Loading (PRPL, H/2 Push, HTTP/2, route-based chunking)
list.description: Developers want to load their PWAs fast and become interactive as soon as possible. This could be with patterns like PRPL, HTTP/2 Server Push or just serving down less stuff for each route. We want to make sure browsers have a good story here. Let's talk about what challenges folks face shipping fast experiences today, what works and what doesn't and figure out how we can make this better.

list.title: Houdini
list.description: Houdini - the real bits. Houdini is the next big thing™ in CSS and will give many new abilities for web developers. A lot is still pure theory, but let’s talk about the parts that have already been implemented in some browsers and can be experimented with.

17:00:00.name: Browser Vendor panel
17:00:00.speaker: TBD
17:00:00.description: Representatives from various browsers answer your questions.
